root.text:
Honda Element 4WD EX

Base price: $21,000 (estimated); Engine: 2.4-liter, 160-h.p. 4-cylinder; Fuel economy: 20 m.p.g. city/23 highway. Part sport-utility, wagon, van and truck, a multipurpose machine with a host of functions but a love it or hate it design featuring lots of plastic body cladding. Targeted at youth on a budget. 2WD or 4WD. Rear seats fold flat against the sidewalls to open the cargo compartment, but block side-window visibility. Fairly peppy but hardly quiet 4-cylinder. Suspension tuned for, well, youth on a budget. Neat features: removable glass skylight; wide open front/rear doors, with rear doors that swing back suicide style; waterproof seat fabric; and water resistant cargo floor. On sale in December as new vehicle alternative to youth having to settle for Dad's hand-me-down Crown Victoria.

Mateja, Jim

Tribune News Service

October 11, 2002
